ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to properly write a scientific paper, how to design and plan an experiment by oneself, various new laboratory procedures, including rotovap, large-scale separation, NMR, GC/MS, etc.

I think this class taught me a lot of valuable skills - from how to write a proper report to conducting long term experiments to designing my own experiment to analyzing large quantities of data and beyond!

I learned a lot more about hydrogenation reactions and organic chemistry of that nature that wasn't really covered in orgo lecture. I also learned to be a bit more independent after being entrusted to take on a project for the entire second half of the semester. You learn how to handle stuff on your own in a research-ish setting.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Its strength and weakness lies in the amount of freedom given to the student for the latter half of the semester, as at times it's unclear as to what exactly the expectations are.
The strength in this was definitely the format - learning how to conduct an experiment given to us and then the planning and executing our own!

The only weakness I feel applied to this course is that Canvas is glitchy but that can't be helped. The professors and TA were great and always available to help. I feel like the small class size was a major benefit, as the number of professors/TAs/lab personnel made the student/teacher ratio almost 1:1. I also appreciate being encouraged to take on a project that was outside the realm of organic chemistry. I feel like everyone got the chance to do something unique and really enjoyed the final outcome. Also the professors *actually edit* your drafts/papers instead of looking at your draft and saying "yeah looks fine" then wrecking whatever your final thing is.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, this course is very good at developing important lab skills that other labs (such as gen chem lab, orgo lab) don't cover.
It's a great lab to take even if you don't need it for the chem major, you only need to have taken orgo 1 and 2 and the labs I think.
